newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan stocks again locked in narrow range.
newsitem.headline: Jordan stocks again locked in narrow range.

text.p: The Amman exchange continued to trade in a very narrow range on Monday in thin deals with investors on the sidelines awaiting new direction, dealers.
The Amman Financial Market 60-share index fell 0.16 points to 146.81 points in trade worth 315,563 dinars ($445,710).
Overall fourteen shares advanced, thirteen fell and six were unchanged in dull trade with minimal purchasing power.

Jordan Gulf Bank and Arab Bank Group again were the two busiest stocks, accounting for a third of the day's total turnover. Jordan Gulf Bank closed higher a slight 0.02 dinars at 0.91 dinars and Arab Bank was unchanged at 245 dinars.

"The market is not in decline... but in a stability mood awaiting for a positive change either in demand or in political or economic factors," said Mohammed Abdulhah, financial consultant, at Pearl Consulting firm.

The AFM index has been stuck for the seven weeks within a point either side of 147.7 points. Daily turnover has halved during the same period to around 500,000 dinars from about one million dinars a day in September.
The private Pearl Investable Index of the 45 best performing shares on the exchange shed 0.27 percent to 79.04 points, still 17.24 percent down from the same time last year.

A total of 226,689 shares worth 101,002 dinars changed hands in weak trade in the parallel market dominated by National Multi Engineering (Namico), with 52,500 shares exchanging hands. Of 19 shares traded, four advanced, six declined and nine were unchanged.
